content: quote: Originally posted by Fightdirector: One of the things that I have found interesting (and, frankly, upsetting) as a Viet-Nam veteran (1/5 Inf Div, 1970-1971) is that the four biggest mouthpieces for the Right; Rush Limbaugh, Bill O'Reilly, Sean Hannity and Michael "Michael Savage" Weiner; are all Chickenhawks. quote: CHICKENHAWK n. A person enthusiastic about war, provided someone else fights it; particularly when that enthusiasm is undimmed by personal experience with war; most emphatically when that lack of experience came in spite of ample opportunity in that person's youth. Limbaugh, O'Reilly and Weiner all were draft dodgers during the Viet-Nam War period (I believe Hannity was too young for Viet-Nam, but he never took the opportunity to serve between the age of 18 and 35). And yet today these are the people we're being constantly told that they are more patriotic than anyone else and who are supposed to know who is and who isn't a good American. The mind boggles. Four gutless, yellow cowards - now supposedly the oracles as to who is and who isn't a loyal, real American. What a crock! I served 3 tours with the 173rd Airborne as a Recon Team leader, and I'm rated 60% disabled, as is my brother who served in the Marines. We have nothing against anyone who didn't want to go to Vietnam, and stayed out. What we have trouble with are the ones who aided, abetted, and gave the enemy the means to stay fighting. The leaders of North Vietnam were not thanking Limbaugh and company for their help in the war, they were thanking the Kerry, Kennedy, Fonda, Clintons and their ilk. And I quote, "without their help, we couldn't have won the war" As today, when the libs tried everything possible, including Obama, to help the terrorists win. The so called "chicken hawks" have done more to help the troops with money, entertainment, and assistance for the KIA's children than all the libs put together. Not to mention the money they've raised to help the wounded rehabilitate. It wasn't those guys standing outside military hospitals harrassing the wounded and their families. Remember Code Pink? Limbaugh and Co. didn't try to cut off funding for the troops, call them murderers, tell them the war is lost, or oppose the surge. They haven't run ROTC off the campuses nor picketed Marine recruiting stations. Yeh, the Vietnam syndrome is still here. The same people and the same type of people doing everything possible to hurt our troops.

Limbaugh, O'Reilly and Weiner all were draft dodgers during the Viet-Nam War period (I believe Hannity was too young for Viet-Nam, but he never took the opportunity to serve between the age of 18 and 35). And yet today these are the people we're being constantly told that they are more patriotic than anyone else and who are supposed to know who is and who isn't a good American. The mind boggles. Four gutless, yellow cowards - now supposedly the oracles as to who is and who isn't a loyal, real American.
reply: What a crock! I served 3 tours with the 173rd Airborne as a Recon Team leader, and I'm rated 60% disabled, as is my brother who served in the Marines. We have nothing against anyone who didn't want to go to Vietnam, and stayed out. What we have trouble with are the ones who aided, abetted, and gave the enemy the means to stay fighting. The leaders of North Vietnam were not thanking Limbaugh and company for their help in the war, they were thanking the Kerry, Kennedy, Fonda, Clintons and their ilk. And I quote, "without their help, we couldn't have won the war" As today, when the libs tried everything possible, including Obama, to help the terrorists win. The so called "chicken hawks" have done more to help the troops with money, entertainment, and assistance for the KIA's children than all the libs put together. Not to mention the money they've raised to help the wounded rehabilitate. It wasn't those guys standing outside military hospitals harrassing the wounded and their families. Remember Code Pink? Limbaugh and Co. didn't try to cut off funding for the troops, call them murderers, tell them the war is lost, or oppose the surge. They haven't run ROTC off the campuses nor picketed Marine recruiting stations. Yeh, the Vietnam syndrome is still here. The same people and the same type of people doing everything possible to hurt our troops.
title: Vietnam Syndrome Still Here?

content: quote: Originally posted by herd173: "...3 tours with the 173rd Airborne as a Recon Team leader..." did you know Glenn English? One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
quote: Originally posted by herd173: "...3 tours with the 173rd Airborne as a Recon Team leader..."
reply: did you know Glenn English? One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
title: Vietnam Syndrome Still Here?

content: I would suggest that the dovehawks are worse than the chickenhawks. These are the anti-war people who say one thing and mean another. Why is it, that so many people thought that our President was going to end the war? If these dovehawks put their money where their mouths were, neither McCain nor Obama would have won the primaries. Apparently, the anti-war sentiment isn't that large, unless when it came to criticizing President Bush.
reply: I would suggest that the dovehawks are worse than the chickenhawks. These are the anti-war people who say one thing and mean another. Why is it, that so many people thought that our President was going to end the war? If these dovehawks put their money where their mouths were, neither McCain nor Obama would have won the primaries. Apparently, the anti-war sentiment isn't that large, unless when it came to criticizing President Bush.
title: Vietnam Syndrome Still Here?

content: quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: quote: Originally posted by herd173: "...3 tours with the 173rd Airborne as a Recon Team leader..." did you know Glenn English? I was at LZ English. There was a guy named English in the 2nd Bn. 503rd at LZ English. I didn't know his first name.
quote: Originally posted by m551sheridan: quote: Originally posted by herd173: "...3 tours with the 173rd Airborne as a Recon Team leader..." did you know Glenn English?
reply: I was at LZ English. There was a guy named English in the 2nd Bn. 503rd at LZ English. I didn't know his first name.
title: Vietnam Syndrome Still Here?

content: quote: Originally posted by dragonflyer04: Okay...but he then (while in the Guard)with the exception one day went to work on an Alabama US Senatorial campaign according to his CO? There are questions about his service. He never attempted to explain them. What is there to explain? CBS and Dan Rather used provably fake documents to expose the CBS slander. Then old Dan claimed, maybe the documents were false, but the charges were true. Amazing! The same people who bash Bush, and I wasn't aware that learning how to fly a miliatry jet was somehow cowardly, give Clinton, a true draft dodger a pass. Bush's CO never once questioned Bush's actions. That came up from an old secretary who claimed she heard his CO say that. Bush didn't go to Vietnam because the goverment made the decision not to send the jets he learned to fly to Vietnam. Kerry on the other hand was a true coward. Claiming Purple hearts he didn't deserve. One minicule piece of shrapnel was scraped off, another he claim he hand carried in, and the 3rd was self inflicted goofing off with a M-79 grenade launcher. At least my brother's and mine were real!
quote: Originally posted by dragonflyer04: Okay...but he then (while in the Guard)with the exception one day went to work on an Alabama US Senatorial campaign according to his CO? There are questions about his service. He never attempted to explain them.
reply: What is there to explain? CBS and Dan Rather used provably fake documents to expose the CBS slander. Then old Dan claimed, maybe the documents were false, but the charges were true. Amazing! The same people who bash Bush, and I wasn't aware that learning how to fly a miliatry jet was somehow cowardly, give Clinton, a true draft dodger a pass. Bush's CO never once questioned Bush's actions. That came up from an old secretary who claimed she heard his CO say that. Bush didn't go to Vietnam because the goverment made the decision not to send the jets he learned to fly to Vietnam. Kerry on the other hand was a true coward. Claiming Purple hearts he didn't deserve. One minicule piece of shrapnel was scraped off, another he claim he hand carried in, and the 3rd was self inflicted goofing off with a M-79 grenade launcher. At least my brother's and mine were real!
title: Vietnam Syndrome Still Here?

reply: he won the MOH One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: herd...George was protected by his Dad at the time...and he had lotsa personal problems. The secretary dug up somethings and the records (from everything I have read) show he did work on a Republican political campaign... and reported in to the Unit only once while he was there. As for Kerry? He made it to Nam...he was shot at and maybe he got too many medals for what he did...others did too and some of us did not...but we were there. n PS the RVN Advisory Team I was on was replaced by the 173rd Thanks. I always wanted to say thanks to someone.
reply: herd...George was protected by his Dad at the time...and he had lotsa personal problems. The secretary dug up somethings and the records (from everything I have read) show he did work on a Republican political campaign... and reported in to the Unit only once while he was there. As for Kerry? He made it to Nam...he was shot at and maybe he got too many medals for what he did...others did too and some of us did not...but we were there. n PS the RVN Advisory Team I was on was replaced by the 173rd Thanks. I always wanted to say thanks to someone.
